Module: InsightUtils

InsightUtils

This module contains some helper functions used throughout the library

Methods

staticmodule:InsightUtils.getSVGBoundingBox(element){object}

utils/insight.Utils.js, line 148
This function takes a SVG element and returns a bounding box of coordinates at each of its compass points
Name Type Description
element DOMElement The element to measure
Returns:
- A bounding box object {nw: ..., n: ..., ne: ..., e: ..., se: ..., s: ..., sw: ..., w: ...}

staticmodule:InsightUtils.isArray(input){boolean}

utils/insight.Utils.js, line 46
This is a utility method used to check if an object is an array or not
Name Type Description
input object The object to check
Returns:
- is the object an array

staticmodule:InsightUtils.keySelector(data){string}

utils/insight.Utils.js, line 65
This function takes a data point, and creates a class name for insight to identify this particular key If the parameter is not an object (just a value in an array) then there is no need for this particular class so blank is returned.
Name Type Description
data object The input point
Returns:
- A class name to identify this point and any other points taking the same value in other charts.

staticmodule:InsightUtils.multiSort(data, sorters){object[]}

utils/insight.Utils.js, line 129
This function takes an array and a list of sort objects, sorting the array (in place) using the provided priorities and returning that array at the end.
Name Type Description
data object[] The array to sort. It will be sorted in place (as per Javascript sort standard behaviour) and returned at the end.
sorters object[] A list of sorting rules [{sortFunction: function(a){return a.valueToSortOn;}, order: 'ASC'}]
Returns:
- The sorted array

staticmodule:InsightUtils.objectUnion(base, extend){object}

utils/insight.Utils.js, line 109
This function takes two objects and returns the union, with priority given to the first parameter in the event of clashes. This bias is used for scenarios where user defined CSS properties must not override default values.
Name Type Description
base object The base object to have priority in the union operation.
extend object The object to extend from, adding any additional properties and values defined in this parameter.
Returns:
- a shallow copy representing the union between the provided objects
